result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Andrew J. Helgestad was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Andrew J. Helgestad was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew J. Helgestad in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was set for pre-trial today but there the parties have resolution.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2.  Count 3 along with 14TR1491 - 1493 and 14TR1447 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2.  Count 3 along with 14TR1491 - 1493 and 14TR1447 to be dismissed.  

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 75 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before April 1, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*May transfer to Columbia County
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge (if not done so already)

Ct. 2:  Court orders 17 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to Ct. 1 and any other sentence
  Report on or before April 1, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*May transfer to Columbia County
*Credit = 4 days
*Pay fine and costs = $1,505.00
*14 month DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock
*AODA and any follow-up treatment

Ct. 3 along with 14TR1491 - 1493 and 14TR1447 to be dismissed.
bond to be applied
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in April

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Jury trial on March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew J. Helgestad in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic tickets tracking with:
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Trial.
bond continued.
Arraignment on November 12, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew J. Helgestad in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic matters tracking with
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the Preliminary Hearing and asks for an Arraignment date be set.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and would like the Prelim waived.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee states that the information is on his desk and asks if he can file it with the court after the hearing.
BY THE COURT:  Court will allow the State to file the information after the hearing.
Set for Arraignment.
bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Andrew J. Helgestad in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  Set for Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 11:15 am.
